newsitem.title: SWEDEN: H&M says sales up 30 pct Q1, trend positive.
newsitem.headline: H&M says sales up 30 pct Q1, trend positive.

text.p: Swedish fashion retailer Hennes & Mauritz (H&M) said on Thursday that sales rose 30 percent in the first quarter of 1997 compared to Q1 1996 and the sales and earnings trend remained positive.
H&M said in a statement released to coincide with its annual general meeting that 1996 had been a very good year with profit after financial items rising 40 percent to 2.03 billion crowns.
"The positive trend in sales in comparable shops -- and therefore also in earnings -- which started a year ago remains so far in 1997," the company said in a statement.
In the first three months of the year sales rose 30 percent against the same period a year ago.
"But it is worth noting that the comparative period a year ago was relatively weak," H&M said.
In the financial year 1996/97 H&M planned to open 50 new stores across Europe, adding to its current list of about 450 stores.
The company has already decided that it will open its first outlets in Finland this autumn and in spring 1998 it will open stores in France.
H&M shares rose on the announcement and at 1230 GMT were trading 32 crowns higher at 1,032 crowns.
